ngiemboon: Yesyɛ̂b la cʉ́ʼʉ ńne ńkuʼu lékúʼte mbùm yé, á mvfò pʉ̀a pé metsèm wɔ́. Ńdeen ńgaʼte, ńtsẅi ngie pɔ́ kẅɛ; tà ńgwaa gÿo mefɛ̌ pé zsé nyìŋ gẅie aa yé, pâ pɔ̌ cʉ́ʼ ńgwɔ́ ndá pɔ́ gíle pɔ́b.
en: Joseph could no longer keep his composure in front of all his attendants,   so he called out, “Send everyone away from me! ” No one was with him when he revealed his identity to his brothers.  # 45:1 Ac 7:13

ngiemboon: À la kwéʼe ngyè ye, ńdʉa. Epʉ̀a Egíbtò júʼ ngyè ye; epʉ̀a pie ée ndá Falahoŋ gíŋe ńjúʼ yɔ́b.
en: But he wept so loudly that the Egyptians heard it, and also Pharaoh’s household heard it.

ngiemboon: Yesyɛ̂b gɔɔn né mefɛ̌ pé ngie: «Mèŋ n gee Yesyɛ̂b. Tà tá wɔ̀ɔn nyé wó?» Á zɛ́te púʼu, mefɛ̌ pé tyé mvfò yé ńtebe, tà pɔ́ té kuʼu létsɔ́ʼ wɔ́.
en: Joseph said to his brothers, “I am Joseph! Is my father still living? ” But they could not answer him because they were terrified in his presence.

ngiemboon: Yesyɛ̂b gɔɔn né mefɛ̌ pé ngie: «Shúshu! Pi tó páʼɔɔn.» Pɔ́ leen ńtó. Á gɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ n gee fɛ̌ gẅi Yesyɛ̂b gẅie pi la sẅiŋe yé, mé lɔgɔ yé ńgʉa né Egíbtò.
en: Then Joseph said to his brothers, “Please, come near me,” and they came near. “I am Joseph, your brother,” he said, “the one you sold into Egypt.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼɔɔn la, pi pɔ́ɔn lémÿɔg; ndyɛ̀ʼ legwɔ́ gie pi la sẅiŋe wɔ́ɔn, á gÿo pi gyáŋa lóŋ. Ńtí nue e Ssé la tʉ́ njÿó, ńtúmo wɔ́ɔn jʉʼɔɔn, légÿo pi tsẅɛ́.
en: And now don’t be grieved or angry with yourselves for selling me here, because God sent me ahead of you to preserve life.

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngùʼ pʉ́a, páʼ cÿó ka kúu tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ. Mé gíŋe ńgẅiin mengùʼ méntʉ̂a mie mé té jʉʼ shúm wɔ́, é ké le lag.
en: For the famine has been in the land these two years, and there will be five more years without plowing or harvesting.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la tʉ́ njÿó ńtúmo wɔ́ɔn, á tsɛ̀ɛ wɔɔn ngwòŋ, légwɔ́ gie pi gẅiin ngẅɛ̀, ńtsẅɛ́ nzyè, aa letsɔgɔ.
en: God sent me ahead of you to establish you as a remnant within the land and to keep you alive by a great deliverance.

ngiemboon: Pi zɔ la te túmo wɔ́ɔn jʉʼɔɔn wɔ́. E Ssé zɔ la túmo wɔ́ɔn. À la lɔgɔ wɔ́ɔn ńgÿo tá pà Falahoŋ, ńgÿo n gwɔ́ táfàʼ á nɔʼ yé, ńgÿo n gwɔ́ ŋwáláʼ twómbúm tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Egíbtò.
en: Therefore it was not you who sent me here, but God. He has made me a father to Pharaoh, lord of his entire household, and ruler over all the land of Egypt.

ngiemboon: Pi lwo ńgiŋ ńgʉa ńtsẅi né tá wɔ̀ɔn ngie: «Anò gie míŋ gù Yesyɛ̂b tsẅǐi, á yɔɔn: E Ssé la lɔgɔ wɔ́ɔn, ńgÿo ŋwáláʼ twómbúm tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Egíbtò ntsèm, tóo ńtsɛ́ɛ wɔ́ɔn té láte.
en: “Return quickly to my father and say to him, ‘This is what your son Joseph says: “God has made me lord of all Egypt. Come down to me without delay.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ge tó tsẅé lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ, á tsɛ̀ɛ pàga láʼ Ngɔshÿɛn. Ɔ̀ ge gwaa tó, pi lâ penkʉ́ pú lâ penkʉ́ penkʉ́ pú gwɔ́; ɔ̀ ge gíŋe gẅiin menɔ̀ɔn pú: é menjʉ̀njÿò, é mvfó, é mefòŋ, tà mbɔɔ kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie áa jú.
en: You can settle in the land of Goshen   and be near me #— #you, your children, and your grandchildren, your flocks, your herds, and all you have.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ge tóo jʉʼɔɔn ŋwɛ́, n náa kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á ne ńzága gú. Ńtí páʼ cÿó ge gíŋe gÿo mengùʼ méntʉ̂a tá mag. Púʼu atsɔ́ mmó le zága gú wɔ́, é ké le zága ndá gù wɔ́, atsɔ́ mmó jú piŋ ńké le pyé.»
en: There I will sustain you, for there will be five more years of famine. Otherwise, you, your household, and everything you have will become destitute.” ’

ngiemboon: Yesyɛ̂b gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: «Kwàʼ pi gí ne ńgyá né menÿɔ́g mí; afɛ̌ wɔ̀ɔn Mbɛŋjÿamɛŋ ne ńgyá yé né mé menÿɔ́g. Aa kwàʼ wɔ́ɔn gẅie n gɔɔn nò né pi.
en: Look! Your eyes and the eyes of my brother Benjamin can see that I’m   the one speaking to you.

ngiemboon: Pi ge pú laʼte mbwó tá wɔ̀ɔn shúm ntsèm sie pi gyǎ, é laʼte legúʼ wɔ̀ɔn á ngwòŋ Egíbtò. Pi lwo ńgʉa ńdɔgɔ yé ńtó né jʉʼɔɔn.»
en: Tell my father about all my glory in Egypt and about all you have seen. And bring my father here quickly.”

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn púʼu, pɔ́ Mbɛŋjÿamɛŋ táŋte mennɛ́, ḿbú ńdʉa.
en: Then Joseph threw his arms around his brother Benjamin and wept, and Benjamin wept on his shoulder.

ngiemboon: À la fó na yé ńgwaa faŋte mefɛ̌ pé ntsèm, ńké ne ńdʉa lʉa. Ńdeen ńgÿo púʼu, tá mefɛ̌ pé gíŋe ńkuʼu légɔɔn nò né yé.
en: Joseph kissed each of his brothers as he wept,   and afterward his brothers talked with him.

ngiemboon: Mé la fó nɔʼɔ Falahoŋ ńjúʼ ngie mefɛ̌ Yesyɛ̂b tǒo Egíbtò. Anò pú ḿboŋo Falahoŋ lâ ngàŋafàʼ yé.
en: When the news reached Pharaoh’s palace, “Joseph’s brothers have come,” Pharaoh and his servants were pleased.

ngiemboon: Falahoŋ tsẅi né Yesyɛ̂b ngie: «Tsẅi né mefɛ̌ pú ngie pɔ́ lɔg pìʼ sɔ́b ńkwɔ́ʼ menzikáasè mɔ́b, ńgʉa Kánàhan,
en: Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Tell your brothers, ‘Do this: Load your animals and go on back to the land of Canaan.

ngiemboon: ńdɔgɔ tá gẅi lâ pʉ̀a pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ metsìŋendá mí, ńtó né lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ. N ge ná shúm mbòŋo sie ée ngwòŋ Egíbtò né pi. Pi piŋ ḿpfɛ́ shúm mbòŋo sie é kẅɛɛ tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ.
en: Get your father and your families, and come back to me. I will give you the best of the land of Egypt, and you can eat from the richness of the land.’

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ gẅiin légɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie pɔ́ gwaa fó ngwòŋ Egíbtò, ńkaa mekélêg lÿóon mie pɔ́ ge gÿo gwaa piŋ né jʉʼɔɔn, é lɔg kaa penkʉ́ pɔ́b lâ mezwě pɔ́b tà mbɔɔ tá wɔ́b.
en: You are also commanded to tell them, ‘Do this: Take wagons from the land of Egypt for your dependents and your wives and bring your father here.

ngiemboon: Ndyɛ̀ʼ pɔ́ lʉa shúm sie pɔ́ ge gwáʼa wó. Ńtí nue eshúm mbòŋo sie ée tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Egíbtò ntsèm, é ge gÿo gwɔ́ sɔ́b.»
en: Do not be concerned about your belongings, for the best of all the land of Egypt is yours.’ ”

ngiemboon: Epenkʉ́ Yakwɔ̂b gÿo páʼ mé tsẅǐi. Yesyɛ̂b la ná mekélêg lÿóon né pɔ́b páʼ Falahoŋ la tsẅi. Ńgíŋe ńná shúm léjÿó sie pɔ́ ge tsẅág.
en: The sons of Israel did this. Joseph gave them wagons as Pharaoh had commanded, and he gave them provisions for the journey.

ngiemboon: À la náa mekúbe nzsǒ né pɔ́b metsèm. Ńgʉa na Mbɛŋjÿamɛŋ, á náa sílépà nkáb pàg nkÿo tá né yé ńgÿo menzsǒ méntʉ̂a.
en: He gave each of the brothers changes of clothes,   but he gave Benjamin three hundred pieces of silver and five changes of clothes.  # 45:22 Gn 43:34

ngiemboon: Ḿbiŋ ńgʉa na tá we, á túm shúm mbòŋo sie ée Egíbtò né yé; tà mé lɔg menzikáasè legém tá ńkaa. Ńgíŋe ńdɔg tsɔ́ menzikáasè legém pie ée mezwě ńkaa ngesáŋ ntsíŋ, ńkaa mbelég, ńgÿo shúm léjÿó sie tá we ge gÿo gwaa cʉ́me mánzsè, é tsẅág.
en: He sent his father the following: ten donkeys carrying the best products of Egypt and ten female donkeys carrying grain, food, and provisions for his father on the journey.

ngiemboon: Ńgÿo púʼu, ńgwaa nyé wɔ́b pɔ́ gʉa, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Pi pɔ́ɔn ndʉʼʉ́ndʉʼʉ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi mánzsè.»
en: So Joseph sent his brothers on their way, and as they were leaving, he said to them, “Don’t argue   on the way.”

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ fó Egíbtò, ḿbʉ tà ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Kánàhan, á mbʉ̀a tá wɔ́b Yakwɔ̂b.
en: So they went up from Egypt and came to their father Jacob in the land of Canaan.

ngiemboon: Ńkúu wó, éshwóŋo yé ngie: «Yesyɛ̂b nyě ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ntʉ̀ntʉ̀! Yé zɔ pǔ sáʼa ngwòŋ Egíbtò ntsèm.» Táʼ, tá wɔ́b te nò gɔɔn. Ńtí nue à la júʼ, à te lɔg ńtóŋo tsɔ́ nò wɔ́.
en: They said, “Joseph is still alive, and he is ruler over all the land of Egypt! ” Jacob was stunned,   for he did not believe them.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ pú ḿbíte menò mie Yesyɛ̂b ka gɔɔn, éshwóŋo tá wɔb. Tá wɔ́b Yakwɔ̂b gyá mekélêg lÿóon mie Yesyɛ̂b ka túm páʼ mé ge lɔg kaa yé, mbùm ye leen ńké kyɛ́ʼɛ.
en: But when they told Jacob all that Joseph had said to them, and when he saw the wagons that Joseph had sent to transport him, the spirit of their father Jacob revived.

ngiemboon: Yakwɔ̂b gɔɔn ngie: «Wɔɔn nzẅìŋ kaa kɔ́gɔ! Míŋ wɔ́ɔn Yesyɛ̂b nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó, n ge gʉa tà sɔb nÿɔ́g na yé tá kwé.»
en: Then Israel said, “Enough! My son Joseph is still alive. I will go to see him before I die.”
